wiki.content:
"Be Yourself" is the first single by Audioslave for their second album Out of Exile. It was released in 2005. 
 
 The lyrics were inspired by events from frontman Chris Cornell's own life. "The 'be yourself' part really just came from a lot of things that I've gone through in my life and a lot of different changes and all the different tragedies and all the horrendously stupid mistakes I've made in my personal life, and wanting to be able to make up for those things and wanting to be able to not be ashamed, all that stuff," he explained. "You know, that's the one thing about getting older that's better, and this song kinda says it so simply, to a degree that 10 years ago I would've been embarrassed to put it in a song 'cause it is so simple. But there it is."
 
 This song was one the theme songs for Wrestlemania 26. 
        
User-contributed text is available under the Creative Commons By-SA License and may also be available under the GNU FDL.
wiki.summary: "Be Yourself" is the first single by Audioslave for their second album Out of Exile. It was released in 2005.   The lyrics were inspired by events from frontman Chris Cornell's own life. "The 'be yourself' part really just came from a lot of things that I've gone through in my life and a lot of different changes and all the different tragedies and all the horrendously stupid mistakes I've made in my personal life, and wanting to be able to make up for those things and wanting to be able to not be ashamed, all that stuff," he explained.

track.name: Be Yourself
comments: @SchizoRebel, I hope that you feel better after your little soliloquy. It was completely pointless.
There is a lot of truth in the lyrics. Love this song!

Disagreeing with rhoads77. Eddie Vedder is a terrible vocalist--you can't tell what he's singing half of the time. He (Vedder) is unique, certainly. But that doesn't make him good. Cornell is a slightly raw-voiced belter. Vedder is a mumbling fool, the Michael Stipe of grunge, though frankly that comparison disrespects Stipe. I listen to Pearl Jam but not for Vedder, that's for certain.
One of the best, if not THE best male voice of the past 25 yrs.  Eddie Vedder is up there too though.
we have and always will be.you say it all.nice tunes
